IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY PROVIDING FAITH-BASED NON PROFIT SERVICES TO ELDERS IN WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Passavant Retirement Community is a 501(c)(3) continuing care retirement community with a 100+ year history of providing faith-based, non profit services to elders in Western Pennsylvania.
IRS990.Description: Passavant Retirement Community is a 501(c)(3) continuing care retirement community with a 105 year history of providing faith-based, non profit services to elders in Western Pennsylvania. Located on 42 acres in Zelienople, PA, Passavant Retirement Community is one of the Lutheran SeniorLife communities dedicated to providing opportunities for seniors to experience an Abundant LifeSM. Passavant provides residential living in a number of venues: cottages, villas and apartments; personal care in two venues and long-term and skilled nursing care, averaging 560 residents per month on campus during the fiscal year. In the year ending June 30, 2010, Passavant provided 54,692 days of nursing services, 26,356 of which were covered through medical assistance payments. The staff at Passavant is committed to providing seniors with opportunities to live life abundantly, which is accomplished through delivering person centered care and focusing on community life. Programs and services are offered in six spheres: physical, spiritual, recreational, intellectual, vocational, and creative; providing opportunities for each resident to learn and grow no matter their age. We continue to strive to provide exceptional person centered care and continue to be recognized by CMS as a 5 Star facility.In the year ending June 30, 2010, Passavant Retirement Community provided 58,139 days of service to personal care residents. Because residents accepted into our continuum are not asked to leave should they outlive their resources, our personal care level is where most of our "benevolent care" dollars are spent. $333,350 of "benevolent care" was provided to personal care residents in the year ending June 30, 2010. Our waiting list remains strong (6 months or longer) for our personal care apartments and consequently our occupancy levels are very strong at 95%. We invested in the physical structures of both personal care venues adding a music and meditation room in the Main Building and New Haven Court was completely remodeled much to the delight of the residents. Wittenberg Place, an independent living apartment building of 72 apartments, ended the year with a census of 86.5%, which is slightly down from previous years. Due to the fact that many residents have resided there for a long period of time a number of apartments are currently being rented considerably below market rates. The assistance subsidy provided to the residents of Wittenberg by Passavant is approximately $395,000 annually, including $38,875 of benevolent care. Prices have been lowered at Wittenberg Place and most utilities are included in the monthly fee. There are 112 cottages on Passavant's campus where independent and active seniors live, which includes two original cottages on our campus (circa 1907). Census remained healthy at 91%. A number of Passavant's independent cottages are rented below the current market rate. As a result, the Passavant community subsidizes the cottage rental by approximately $359,000 annually, including $25,402 of benevolent care. In addition, 42 new residential living units, including 18 Villas and 24 Manor Home apartments were completed. All of those units are two bedroom two bath units. In the year ending June 30, 2010 11 Villas and 14 Manor Home apartments were occupied yielding a 59.5% occupancy rate. We continue to provide programming to the community at large through the Highmark Silversneakers exercise program and have over 480 people registered as participants. We also provide Preventative Health Services through Highmark to residents, employees and community members. We continue to focus on the wellness not only of our residents but of staff as well and offered programs such as "Drop 10 in 10" with great success. The Fitness Center also launched new programs such as a Parkinson's Support Group and Sign Chi Do. Through fundraisers, they were able to contribute to local Food Banks as well as the Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank.Residents all over campus had the opportunity to participate in many new programs this past year through our Lifelong University. Our Community Life Without Walls affords individuals who are not able to participate in group programs the opportunity to connect with others through chat lines and other vehicles. We also were licensed as a Home Care Agency this year and added an Adult Day Program for residents. The "My Day Out" program affords caregivers a respite as their loved one is provided meaningful activity and support. Our campus also remains home to the Zelienople Senior Center providing programs and services along with a hot lunch to seniors on campus as well as to the community. It is a wonderful community outreach which we were thrilled to host. In addition Passavant supports the local community through several initiatives such as Salvation Army's Ring the Bell, sponsorship of Zelienople's HorseTrading Days and through contributions to the Community Chest.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: PROVIDED A COPY OF THE FINAL FORM 990 TO MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Annual Conflict of Interest Disclosure statements are required from all Board Members and Executives.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive Committee of the Lutheran SeniorLife Board of Directors conducts an annual performance review in July. The VP of Human Resources compiles market information for the Committees review. The Board then determines the compensation for the CEO.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND TAX FORMS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AT THE CORPORATE OFFICE.
